answers.answer: lattice is thin spots on the retina and occurs in perhaps 6-8% of people, more in nearsighted people. I have lattice myself. No treatment is usually indicated unless holes, tears or retinal detachment develops.Paste this link in your internet browser to see a picture and learn more.http://www.revoptom.com/handbook/sect5e.htmJCH III MD

question: Respected Sir/Madam.Myself zaki mavli, from india would like to know about lattice degeneration. I have minor problems in eyes as floaters I see frequently. Opthalmologist diagnosed as this condition for lattice degenration. I am 24 year old man without any cardiac,respiratory illness without any significant history like Diabetes,Hypertension. Any treatment to progress that growth of this problem. It would be highly appriciable to get back from you thank youwith regardsZAKI
title: lattice degeneration of retina
